art.quote: Everything you can imagine is real.
art.author: Pablo Picasso

art.quote: A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable, but more useful than a life spent doing nothing.
art.author: George Bernard Shaw

art.quote: Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up.
art.author: Pablo Picasso

art.quote: A painter should begin every canvas with a wash of black, because all things in nature are dark except where exposed by the light.
art.author: Leonardo da Vinci

art.quote: Painting is poetry that is seen rather than felt, and poetry is painting that is felt rather than seen.
art.author: Leonardo da Vinci

art.quote: Art is the lie that enables us to realize the truth.
art.author: Pablo Picasso

art.quote: You must have chaos within you to give birth to a dancing star.
art.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

art.quote: The most beautiful experience we can have is the mysterious - the fundamental emotion which stands at the cradle of true art and true science.
art.author: Albert Einstein

art.quote: If you ask me what I came to do in this world, I, an artist, will answer you: I am here to live out loud.
art.author: Émile Zola

art.quote: Art enables us to find ourselves and lose ourselves at the same time.
art.author: Thomas Merton

humour.quote: I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by.
humour.author: Douglas Adams

humour.quote: Those who believe in telekinetics, raise my hand.
humour.author: Kurt Vonnegut

humour.quote: Going to church doesn’t make you a Christian any more than going to a garage makes you an automobile.
humour.author: Billy Sunday

humour.quote: If you were half as funny as you think you are, you'd be twice as funny as you are now.
humour.author: Cassandra Clare

humour.quote: Never go to bed mad. Stay up and fight.
humour.author: Phyllis Diller

humour.quote: When life gives you lemons, squirt someone in the eye.
humour.author: Cathy Guisewite

humour.quote: I did not attend his funeral, but I sent a nice letter saying I approved of it.
humour.author: Mark Twain

humour.quote: Once you can accept the universe as matter expanding into nothing that is something, wearing stripes with plaid comes easy.
humour.author: Albert Einstein

humour.quote: Sometimes you climb out of bed in the morning and you think, I'm not going to make it, but you laugh inside — remembering all the times you've felt that way.
humour.author: Charles Bukowski

humour.quote: The planet is fine. The people are fucked.
humour.author: George Carlin

inspiration.quote: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
inspiration.author: Oscar Wilde

inspiration.quote: Be the change that you wish to see in the world.
inspiration.author: Mahatma Gandhi

inspiration.quote: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
inspiration.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

inspiration.quote: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
inspiration.author: Mahatma Gandhi

inspiration.quote: Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that.
inspiration.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

inspiration.quote: Without music, life would be a mistake.
inspiration.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

inspiration.quote: Imperfection is beauty, madness is genius and it's better to be absolutely ridiculous than absolutely boring.
inspiration.author: Marilyn Monroe

inspiration.quote: There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle.
inspiration.author: Albert Einstein

inspiration.quote: Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, today is a gift of God, which is why we call it the present.
inspiration.author: Bil Keane

inspiration.quote: We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars.
inspiration.author: Oscar Wilde

life.quote: Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened.
life.author: Dr. Seuss

life.quote: I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best.
life.author: Marilyn Monroe

life.quote: You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.
life.author: Mae West

life.quote: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.
life.author: Robert Frost

life.quote: Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results.
life.author: Narcotics Anonymous

life.quote: To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.
life.author: Oscar Wilde

life.quote: Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans.
life.author: Allen Saunders

life.quote: It is better to be hated for what you are than to be loved for what you are not.
life.author: André Gide

life.quote: It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live.
life.author: J.K. Rowling

life.quote: Good friends, good books, and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life.
life.author: Mark Twain

love.quote: You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams.
love.author: Dr. Seuss

love.quote: A friend is someone who knows all about you and still loves you.
love.author: Elbert Hubbard

love.quote: It is better to be hated for what you are than to be loved for what you are not.
love.author: André Gide

love.quote: It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages.
love.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

love.quote: We accept the love we think we deserve.
love.author: Stephen Chbosky

love.quote: There is never a time or place for true love. It happens accidentally, in a heartbeat, in a single flashing, throbbing moment.
love.author: Sarah Dessen

love.quote: Have you ever been in love? Horrible isn't it? It makes you so vulnerable. It opens your chest and it opens up your heart and it means that someone can get inside you and mess you up.
love.author: Neil Gaiman

love.quote: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage.
love.author: Lao Tzu

love.quote: Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own.
love.author: Robert A. Heinlein

love.quote: I am good, but not an angel. I do sin, but I am not the devil. I am just a small girl in a big world trying to find someone to love.
love.author: Marilyn Monroe

misc.quote: Those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind.
misc.author: Bernard M. Baruch

misc.quote: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
misc.author: Thomas A. Edison

misc.quote: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
misc.author: Winston Churchill

misc.quote: There is only one thing that makes a dream impossible to achieve: the fear of failure.
misc.author: Paulo Coelho

misc.quote: Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night.
misc.author: Edgar Allan Poe

misc.quote: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
misc.author: C.S. Lewis

misc.quote: Some day you will be old enough to start reading fairy tales again.
misc.author: C.S. Lewis

misc.quote: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
misc.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

misc.quote: When someone loves you, the way they say your name is different. You know that your name is safe in their mouth.
misc.author: Jess C. Scott

misc.quote: You know that place between sleeping and awake, that place where you can still remember dreaming? That's where I'll always think of you.
misc.author: J.M. Barrie

people.quote: I love mankind, it's people I can't stand.
people.author: Charles M. Schulz

people.quote: I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal.
people.author: Jane Austen

people.quote: The first time someone shows you who they are, believe them.
people.author: Maya Angelou

people.quote: Never love anyone who treats you like you're ordinary.
people.author: Oscar Wilde

people.quote: I've learned that you can tell a lot about a person by the way (s)he handles these three things: a rainy day, lost luggage, and tangled Christmas tree lights.
people.author: Maya Angelou

people.quote: When you stop expecting people to be perfect, you can like them for who they are.
people.author: Donald Miller

people.quote: The world is a dangerous place to live, not because of the people who are evil, but because of the people who don't do anything about it.
people.author: Albert Einstein

people.quote: People are more difficult to work with than machines. And when you break a person, he can't be fixed.
people.author: Rick Riordan

people.quote: I consider conversations with people to be mind exercises, but I don't want to pull a muscle, so I stretch a lot. That's why I'm constantly either rolling my eyes or yawning.
people.author: Jarod Kintz

people.quote: I wonder how many people don't get the one they want, but end up with the one they're supposed to be with.
people.author: Fannie Flagg

war.quote: God created war so that Americans would learn geography.
war.author: Mark Twain

war.quote: I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought, but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones.
war.author: Albert Einstein

war.quote: War must be, while we defend our lives against a destroyer who would devour all; but I do not love the bright sword for its sharpness, nor the arrow for its swiftness, nor the warrior for his glory. I love only that which they defend.
war.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

war.quote: War is peace. Freedom is slavery. Ignorance is strength.
war.author: George Orwell

war.quote: War is what happens when language fails.
war.author: Margaret Atwood

war.quote: Older men declare war. But it is youth that must fight and die.
war.author: Herbert Hoover

war.quote: It is forbidden to kill; therefore all murderers are punished unless they kill in large numbers and to the sound of trumpets.
war.author: Voltaire

war.quote: There are causes worth dying for, but none worth killing for.
war.author: Albert Camus

war.quote: What difference does it make to the dead, the orphans and the homeless, whether the mad destruction is wrought under the name of totalitarianism or in the holy name of liberty or democracy?
war.author: Mahatma Gandhi

war.quote: If you win, you need not have to explain... If you lose, you should not be there to explain!
war.author: Adolf Hitler

wisdom.quote: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
wisdom.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

wisdom.quote: It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it.
wisdom.author: Maurice Switzer

wisdom.quote: The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool.
wisdom.author: William Shakespeare

wisdom.quote: Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect.
wisdom.author: Mark Twain

wisdom.quote: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

wisdom.quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
wisdom.author: Socrates

wisdom.quote: The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom.
wisdom.author: Isaac Asimov

wisdom.quote: Count your age by friends, not years. Count your life by smiles, not tears.
wisdom.author: John Lennon

wisdom.quote: It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

work.quote: The secret to getting ahead is getting started.
work.author: Mark Twain

work.quote: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
work.author: Confucius

work.quote: Some women choose to follow men, and some women choose to follow their dreams. If you're wondering which way to go, remember that your career will never wake up and tell you that it doesn't love you anymore.
work.author: Lady Gaga

work.quote: I always arrive late at the office, but I make up for it by leaving early.
work.author: Charles Lamb

work.quote: In the name of God, stop a moment, cease your work, look around you.
work.author: Leo Tolstoy

work.quote: Without ambition one starts nothing. Without work one finishes nothing. The prize will not be sent to you. You have to win it.
work.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

work.quote: We often miss opportunity because it's dressed in overalls and looks like work.
work.author: Thomas A. Edison

work.quote: Action may not always bring happiness, but there is no happiness without action.
work.author: William James
